intro: Tapura tchoutoi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, often found on trees or rocks in its natural habitat. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and homes.
